content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.

```julia
function timezone_bumper(dt, bump=3)
    if typeof(dt) == DateTime
        return dt + Hour(bump)
    elseif typeof(dt) == Date
        throw(ArgumentError("Date is not supported"))
    else
        throw(ArgumentError("Unsupported type"))
    end
end
```
This function will increase the provided timestamp by `bump` hours. If a Date object is provided, it throws an error that says "Date is not supported". If any other data type is provided, it throws an error that says "Unsupported type".
